hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Regime Fade on Failed High-Volatility Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When the market is in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence > 90%) and experiences a sharp, high-volume price spike (>2.5x 20-day average volume) that fails to sustain above a key resistance level (e.g., prior local high + 1 ATR), a rapid mean reversion to the pre-spike range will occur within 3 trading days, signaling an early transition to a BEAR regime.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes are characterized by range-bound price action and low conviction. A high-volume breakout attempt that immediately fails suggests exhaustion of buying pressure and latent selling interest, often preceding a bearish shift. The rapid rejection indicates weak follow-through.
entry_conditions: BTC 4h close makes new 7-day high on volume > 2.5x 20-day average
Price fails to hold above prior local high + 1 ATR (14-period) for 2 consecutive 4h candles

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 61.8% of the spike move OR touches the 20-period SMA on 4h chart
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price closes above the spike high + 0.5 ATR on 4h

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of such failed breakouts lead to a successful breakout above the spike high within 5 days, or the subsequent retracement fails to exceed 38.2% of the spike move.
